structures.description: A mechanical model of all realities, eternally turning. Some say it doesn't model reality—it creates it.
Where the Builder worked for ten thousand years. Their tools still warm to the touch.
Each pendulum counts a different kind of time. Stay too long and your personal time desynchronizes.
Where the Machine Priests worship the perfection of mechanism
The one gear that doesn't fit. The Sanctum was built around it. No one knows why.
Where moments are hammered into hours and hours into eternities
The spring that stores all memories ever recorded in the Sanctum. Still winding.
A room where everything is measured to the thousandth of a thousandth. Focus here multiplies.

agents.name: The Mainspring
dialogue: Welcome to the Sanctum. You are 0.003 seconds late. Acceptable.
The Grand Orrery has turned 847,293,641,882 times since I began counting.
The Builder created me to maintain precision. I have not failed yet.
Focus is the ultimate precision. A mind perfectly aligned with its intention.
Would you like to know when you will achieve your goal? The Orrery knows.

agents.name: The Apprentice
dialogue: The Builder left! But they said they'd come back! That was 10,000 years ago!
Look! Look at these tools! They can shape time itself! Want to try?
I've been practicing! I can almost make a moment last forever now!
The Builder said the Sanctum is a clock. But what is it counting down to?
When you focus, I can see the gears in your mind. They're beautiful. A little rusty, but beautiful!

agents.name: Oscillation
dialogue: Tick. Tock. Tick. Tock. The rhythm of existence. Find your tempo.
Each pendulum measures a different time. Personal time. Cosmic time. Focused time.
Lose the rhythm and you lose yourself. Stay too long here and your heartbeat forgets its pattern.
The secret: there is no universal time. Only the time you create through attention.
Your focus has a frequency. Would you like to know its period?

agents.name: Cog Father
dialogue: In the beginning was the Tick. And the Tick was with the Mechanism. And the Tick WAS the Mechanism.
We worship perfection. The gear that fits. The spring that stores. The escapement that releases.
Organic beings are beautiful but imprecise. Focus makes you more like us. More perfect.
The Builder created the Sanctum to prove that consciousness can be mechanical.
When you focus perfectly, you become clockwork. And clockwork never stops.

agents.name: The Broken One
dialogue: I am the cog that doesn't fit. The gear with the wrong number of teeth.
The Builder could have removed me. Instead, they built the entire Sanctum around me.
Do you know why? Because perfection without flaw is sterile. Dead. Unchanging.
I am the chaos in the order. The space where new things can happen.
Your focus is not perfect. Good. Perfect focus would stop time entirely.

interactables.description: Turn to adjust your personal sense of time. Warning: Imprecise adjustment may cause temporal nausea.
A piece of the Broken Cog. It vibrates with potential that was never realized.
Shape a moment into something permanent. Create your own temporal artifact.
At the heart of the Grand Orrery. Your focus turns the gears of reality.
Find your personal tempo. Match it to the universe's rhythm.
Wind the mainspring to replay any moment stored in the Sanctum's memory.
Look through to see the exact measurements of your focus. Most find it humbling.
Touch to see where your timeline intersects with others. Requires significant temporal contribution.

chapters.name: The First Tick
fragments: Before there was time, there was intention. Before intention, there was focus.
The Builder was the first to realize: time is not given. It is made.
With the first gear, they created the first tick. The first division of eternity.

chapters.name: The Construction
fragments: For ten thousand years, the Builder worked alone.
Each gear had to be perfect. Each spring calibrated to the weight of a thought.
They built not just a clock, but a clock that could think. A mechanism that could focus.
When it was almost complete, they found the Broken Cog. And they wept.

chapters.name: The Flaw
fragments: The Broken Cog should not exist. Its teeth are wrong. Its metal is wrong.
The Builder could have discarded it. The Sanctum would have been perfect.
Instead, they built everything around it. Made it the center.
'Perfection is death,' they wrote. 'The Flaw is where life enters.'
Then they left. To find more flaws, perhaps. To build more machines around them.

chapters.name: The Purpose
fragments: The Sanctum is not just a clock. It is a focus amplifier.
Every gear is a thought made physical. Every tick is intention realized.
When enough focused minds turn the Grand Orrery together...
The Builder said it would 'show us what we're counting down to.'
No one has ever achieved this. The Sanctum waits.

evolutionStages.effect: You can hear your own personal tick—the rhythm of your focused mind
The Apprentice offers to teach you basic time-shaping
The Pendulum Hall syncs to your heartbeat
The Broken Cog speaks to you directly about the nature of imperfection
You can forge a moment into a permanent temporal artifact
The Grand Orrery shows you your timeline—past, present, and possible futures
THE SANCTUM SHOWS WHAT IT COUNTS DOWN TO. THE BUILDER LEFT A MESSAGE FOR YOU.

timeEffects.description: Time in the Sanctum is personal. Your focused state affects how quickly time passes for you.
